content: @RalfJ It looks like miri-test-libstd is no longer running. It last ran two weeks ago. GitHub says the reason is that the repo hasn't had activity in the last 60 days. image.png
is there a way to have reliable cron jobs with GHA?
looks like even pushing to the repo doesnt reenable CI, one has to press that button. ugh.

I saw a thread about this on the GitHub Community Forum. According to a post from June on that thread, any activity on the main branch counts as "activity". However, it also said that GitHub was planning to extend that soon to any branch. Not sure what the current status is.

Maybe one solution would be to have another cron job that 1x/month would open a PR to update the Rust version -- it would both automate updating (assuming that nightly was available) and merging it would count as repo activity.
Such cron job needs to use a personal access token I think. Pushing using GITHUB_TOKEN doesn't trigger workflow runs according to the docs.
I was actually suggesting it open a PR. Then (manually) merging that PR should count as activity (I think).
